Title: Two new species of Conidiobolus occuring in Anhui, China
Abstract:
Two new species of Conidiobolus, were isolated from Anhui
province, China. A polyphasic taxonomic approach comprising
morphylogical characters and molecular data (the nuclear large subunit
ribosomal DNA and the translation elongation factor 1 alpha gene
sequences) was applied to determine their novel taxonomic status in the
genus Conidiobolus. C. mirabilis is phylogenetically related to C.
thromoides (ATCC12587), and differed from C. thromoides by the special
formation of zygospores occuring among 2-4 adjacent hyphal segments and
smaller primary conidia. C. pachyzygosporus with thick-walled zygospores
located in a single clade in the phylogenetic tree. Both species are
genetically distinct from morphylogically related species revealed by
phylogenetic analyses except C. lamprauges, C. multivagus and C.
thermophilus.
